newsitem.title: USA: Interactive software Q1 sales seen up 58 percent.
newsitem.headline: Interactive software Q1 sales seen up 58 percent.

text.p: The NPD Group market research firm said on Monday that interactive software sales rose 58 percent in the first quarter from the same period in 1996, led by Nintendo Co Ltd, which held seven of the top eight places on NPD's bestseller list.
NPD said 13.3 million video game software units and 10.4 million computer-entertainment software units were sold during the first quarter, and it expects the trend of higher sales to continue.

"With the recent price drops for both Nintendo 64 and PlayStation hardware, and a healthy line-up of first-rate titles slated for release throughout the rest of the year, 1997 is shaping up to be a monumental year," said NPD's Ryan Brock in a statement.
PlayStation software sales were up 170 percent from a year ago, and Saturn software sales rose 135 percent, NPD said.
Computer entertainment software sales did not increase as fast as video game sales but still were up 38 percent overall, NPD said.
NPD is a privately held market research firm.
